I'm trying to be a bit more careful about the research code that I write, so I'm making a package for the first time.

Is there a configuration that I need to manually set so VSCode can find the function definitions? As in, so the docstrings show up along with the location in the code.
For instance, when editing the code in `test/` , VSCode seems to be unaware of the files in  `src/`, despite being able to run the tests correctly.

Edit: To give a little more information, the structure is roughly the following, where VSCode doesn't find the definition for `foobar()` when editing runtests.jl, despite being able to run the file with `SHIFT+ENTER` correctly

src/Foo.jl
```module Foo
include("Bar.jl")
end```
src/Bar.jl
```"""
    foobar()

This function does something
"""
function foobar()
    return 1
end```
test/runtests.jl
```using Foo, Test
...```
